name: duplicate_entry_error_in_istio_pilot
description: This incident type involves a duplicate entry error in Istio Pilot, which may result in issues with the service it is providing. The error message usually contains information about the instance and labels involved in the error. It is important to investigate and resolve this issue promptly to prevent any further disruptions.

cells.name: cell_1
cells.content:
## Duplicate Entry Error in Istio Pilot
This incident type involves a duplicate entry error in Istio Pilot, which may result in issues with the service it is providing. The error message usually contains information about the instance and labels involved in the error. It is important to investigate and resolve this issue promptly to prevent any further disruptions.

cells.name: cell_2
cells.content: ## Find the Istio Pilot pods running

cells.name: cell_3
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | app='shoreline' | limit=1 | random=1 | `kubectl get pods -n ${NAMESPACE} -l app=istio-pilot`

cells.name: cell_4
cells.content: ## Get logs from the Istio Pilot pod

cells.name: cell_5
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | app='shoreline' | limit=1 | random=1 | `kubectl logs ${POD_NAME} -n ${NAMESPACE} istio-proxy`

cells.name: cell_6
cells.content: ## Check the Istio Pilot configuration file

cells.name: cell_8
cells.content: ## Check the Istio Pilot configuration file for duplicate entries

cells.name: cell_10
cells.content: ## Check the Istio Pilot configuration file for all entries

cells.name: cell_12
cells.content: ## Configuration errors: The duplicate entry error may occur if there are configuration errors in the instance or labels of Istio Pilot. This could happen due to a misconfiguration while setting up Istio Pilot or changes made to the configuration by mistake.

cells.name: cell_14
cells.content: ## Restart the Istio Pilot service to see if that resolves the issue. If not, attempt to roll back to a previous version of the service that was working correctly.
